block.p: The Our Towns column on Thursday, about Sue Sadik, a woman from Clifton, N.J., who reflected on her passion for all things ''Sopranos'' in advance of the series' final episode, misspelled the name of the real street and town where the fictional Satriale's Pork Store is located. It is Kearny Avenue in Kearny, not Kearney. The article also gave an erroneous spelling in some copies for a restaurant chain that Ms. Sadik referred to in disparaging catering options in California, a state she compared unfavorably to New Jersey. It is Applebee's, not Appleby's.

The Our Towns column on Thursday, about Sue Sadik, a woman from Clifton, N.J., who reflected on her passion for all things ''Sopranos'' in advance of the series' final episode, misspelled the name of the real street and town where the fictional Satriale's Pork Store is located. It is Kearny Avenue in Kearny, not Kearney. The article also gave an erroneous spelling in some copies for a restaurant chain that Ms. Sadik referred to in disparaging catering options in California, a state she compared unfavorably to New Jersey. It is Applebee's, not Appleby's.
